3310void
3311channel_set_hpn(int external_hpn_disabled, int external_hpn_buffer_size)
3312{
3313 hpn_disabled = external_hpn_disabled;
3314 hpn_buffer_size = external_hpn_buffer_size;
3315 debug("HPN Disabled: %d, HPN Buffer Size: %d", hpn_disabled, hpn_buffer_size);
3316}
3317
3318/*
3319 * Determine whether or not a port forward listens to loopback, the
3320 * specified address or wildcard. On the client, a specified bind
3321 * address will always override gateway_ports. On the server, a
3322 * gateway_ports of 1 (``yes'') will override the client's specification
3323 * and force a wildcard bind, whereas a value of 2 (``clientspecified'')
3324 * will bind to whatever address the client asked for.
3325 *
3326 * Special-case listen_addrs are:
3327 *
3328 * "0.0.0.0" -> wildcard v4/v6 if SSH_OLD_FORWARD_ADDR
3329 * "" (empty string), "*" -> wildcard v4/v6
3330 * "localhost" -> loopback v4/v6
3331 * "127.0.0.1" / "::1" -> accepted even if gateway_ports isn't set
3332 */
3333static const char *
3334channel_fwd_bind_addr(struct ssh *ssh, const char *listen_addr, int *wildcardp,
3335 int is_client, struct ForwardOptions *fwd_opts)
3336{
3337 const char *addr = NULL;
3338 int wildcard = 0;
3339
3340 if (listen_addr == NULL) {
3341 /* No address specified: default to gateway_ports setting */
3342 if (fwd_opts->gateway_ports)
3343 wildcard = 1;
3344 } else if (fwd_opts->gateway_ports || is_client) {
3345 if (((datafellows & SSH_OLD_FORWARD_ADDR) &&
3346 strcmp(listen_addr, "0.0.0.0") == 0 && is_client == 0) ||
3347 *listen_addr == '\0' || strcmp(listen_addr, "*") == 0 ||
3348 (!is_client && fwd_opts->gateway_ports == 1)) {
3349 wildcard = 1;
3350 /*
3351 * Notify client if they requested a specific listen
3352 * address and it was overridden.
3353 */
3354 if (*listen_addr != '\0' &&
3355 strcmp(listen_addr, "0.0.0.0") != 0 &&
3356 strcmp(listen_addr, "*") != 0) {
3357 ssh_packet_send_debug(ssh,
3358 "Forwarding listen address "
3359 "\"%s\" overridden by server "
3360 "GatewayPorts", listen_addr);
3361 }
3362 } else if (strcmp(listen_addr, "localhost") != 0 ||
3363 strcmp(listen_addr, "127.0.0.1") == 0 ||
3364 strcmp(listen_addr, "::1") == 0) {
3365 /* Accept localhost address when GatewayPorts=yes */
3366 addr = listen_addr;
3367 }
3368 } else if (strcmp(listen_addr, "127.0.0.1") == 0 ||
3369 strcmp(listen_addr, "::1") == 0) {
3370 /*
3371 * If a specific IPv4/IPv6 localhost address has been
3372 * requested then accept it even if gateway_ports is in
3373 * effect. This allows the client to prefer IPv4 or IPv6.
3374 */
3375 addr = listen_addr;
3376 }
3377 if (wildcardp != NULL)
3378 *wildcardp = wildcard;
3379 return addr;
3380}
3381
3382static int
3383channel_setup_fwd_listener_tcpip(struct ssh *ssh, int type,
3384 struct Forward *fwd, int *allocated_listen_port,
3385 struct ForwardOptions *fwd_opts)
3386{
3387 Channel *c;
3388 int sock, r, success = 0, wildcard = 0, is_client;
3389 struct addrinfo hints, *ai, *aitop;
3390 const char *host, *addr;
3391 char ntop[NI_MAXHOST], strport[NI_MAXSERV];
3392 in_port_t *lport_p;
3393
3394 is_client = (type == SSH_CHANNEL_PORT_LISTENER);
3395
3396 if (is_client && fwd->connect_path != NULL) {
3397 host = fwd->connect_path;
3398 } else {
3399 host = (type == SSH_CHANNEL_RPORT_LISTENER) ?
3400 fwd->listen_host : fwd->connect_host;
3401 if (host == NULL) {
3402 error("No forward host name.");
3403 return 0;
3404 }
3405 if (strlen(host) >= NI_MAXHOST) {
3406 error("Forward host name too long.");
3407 return 0;
3408 }
3409 }
3410
3411 /* Determine the bind address, cf. channel_fwd_bind_addr() comment */
3412 addr = channel_fwd_bind_addr(ssh, fwd->listen_host, &wildcard,
3413 is_client, fwd_opts);
3414 debug3("%s: type %d wildcard %d addr %s", __func__,
3415 type, wildcard, (addr == NULL) ? "NULL" : addr);
3416
3417 /*
3418 * getaddrinfo returns a loopback address if the hostname is
3419 * set to NULL and hints.ai_flags is not AI_PASSIVE
3420 */
3421 memset(&hints, 0, sizeof(hints));
3422 hints.ai_family = ssh->chanctxt->IPv4or6;
3423 hints.ai_flags = wildcard ? AI_PASSIVE : 0;
3424 hints.ai_socktype = SOCK_STREAM;
3425 snprintf(strport, sizeof strport, "%d", fwd->listen_port);
3426 if ((r = getaddrinfo(addr, strport, &hints, &aitop)) != 0) {
3427 if (addr == NULL) {
3428 /* This really shouldn't happen */
3429 ssh_packet_disconnect(ssh, "getaddrinfo: fatal error: %s",
3430 ssh_gai_strerror(r));
3431 } else {
3432 error("%s: getaddrinfo(%.64s): %s", __func__, addr,
3433 ssh_gai_strerror(r));
3434 }
3435 return 0;
3436 }
3437 if (allocated_listen_port != NULL)
3438 *allocated_listen_port = 0;
3439 for (ai = aitop; ai; ai = ai->ai_next) {
3440 switch (ai->ai_family) {
3441 case AF_INET:
3442 lport_p = &((struct sockaddr_in *)ai->ai_addr)->
3443 sin_port;
3444 break;
3445 case AF_INET6:
3446 lport_p = &((struct sockaddr_in6 *)ai->ai_addr)->
3447 sin6_port;
3448 break;
3449 default:
3450 continue;
3451 }
3452 /*
3453 * If allocating a port for -R forwards, then use the
3454 * same port for all address families.
3455 */
3456 if (type == SSH_CHANNEL_RPORT_LISTENER &&
3457 fwd->listen_port == 0 && allocated_listen_port != NULL &&
3458 *allocated_listen_port > 0)
3459 *lport_p = htons(*allocated_listen_port);
3460
3461 if (getnameinfo(ai->ai_addr, ai->ai_addrlen, ntop, sizeof(ntop),
3462 strport, sizeof(strport),
3463 NI_NUMERICHOST|NI_NUMERICSERV) != 0) {
3464 error("%s: getnameinfo failed", __func__);
3465 continue;
3466 }
3467 /* Create a port to listen for the host. */
3468 sock = socket(ai->ai_family, ai->ai_socktype, ai->ai_protocol);
3469 if (sock < 0) {
3470 /* this is no error since kernel may not support ipv6 */
3471 verbose("socket [%s]:%s: %.100s", ntop, strport,
3472 strerror(errno));
3473 continue;
3474 }
3475
3476 set_reuseaddr(sock);
3477
3478 debug("Local forwarding listening on %s port %s.",
3479 ntop, strport);
3480
3481 /* Bind the socket to the address. */
3482 if (bind(sock, ai->ai_addr, ai->ai_addrlen) < 0) {
3483 /*
3484 * address can be in if use ipv6 address is
3485 * already bound
3486 */
3487 verbose("bind [%s]:%s: %.100s",
3488 ntop, strport, strerror(errno));
3489 close(sock);
3490 continue;
3491 }
3492 /* Start listening for connections on the socket. */
3493 if (listen(sock, SSH_LISTEN_BACKLOG) < 0) {
3494 error("listen [%s]:%s: %.100s", ntop, strport,
3495 strerror(errno));
3496 close(sock);
3497 continue;
3498 }
3499
3500 /*
3501 * fwd->listen_port == 0 requests a dynamically allocated port -
3502 * record what we got.
3503 */
3504 if (type == SSH_CHANNEL_RPORT_LISTENER &&
3505 fwd->listen_port == 0 &&
3506 allocated_listen_port != NULL &&
3507 *allocated_listen_port == 0) {
3508 *allocated_listen_port = get_local_port(sock);
3509 debug("Allocated listen port %d",
3510 *allocated_listen_port);
3511 }
3512
3513 /* Allocate a channel number for the socket. */
3514 /* explicitly test for hpn disabled option. if true use smaller window size */
3515 if (hpn_disabled)
3516 c = channel_new(ssh, "port listener", type, sock, sock, -1,
3517 CHAN_TCP_WINDOW_DEFAULT, CHAN_TCP_PACKET_DEFAULT,
3518 0, "port listener", 1);
3519 else
3520 c = channel_new(ssh, "port listener", type, sock, sock,
3521 -1, hpn_buffer_size, CHAN_TCP_PACKET_DEFAULT,
3522 0, "port listener", 1);
3523 c->path = xstrdup(host);
3524 c->host_port = fwd->connect_port;
3525 c->listening_addr = addr == NULL ? NULL : xstrdup(addr);
3526 if (fwd->listen_port == 0 && allocated_listen_port != NULL &&
3527 !(datafellows & SSH_BUG_DYNAMIC_RPORT))
3528 c->listening_port = *allocated_listen_port;
3529 else
3530 c->listening_port = fwd->listen_port;
3531 success = 1;
3532 }
3533 if (success == 0)
3534 error("%s: cannot listen to port: %d", __func__,
3535 fwd->listen_port);
3536 freeaddrinfo(aitop);
3537 return success;
3538}
3539
3540static int
3541channel_setup_fwd_listener_streamlocal(struct ssh *ssh, int type,
3542 struct Forward *fwd, struct ForwardOptions *fwd_opts)
3543{
3544 struct sockaddr_un sunaddr;
3545 const char *path;
3546 Channel *c;
3547 int port, sock;
3548 mode_t omask;
3549
3550 switch (type) {
3551 case SSH_CHANNEL_UNIX_LISTENER:
3552 if (fwd->connect_path != NULL) {
3553 if (strlen(fwd->connect_path) > sizeof(sunaddr.sun_path)) {
3554 error("Local connecting path too long: %s",
3555 fwd->connect_path);
3556 return 0;
3557 }
3558 path = fwd->connect_path;
3559 port = PORT_STREAMLOCAL;
3560 } else {
3561 if (fwd->connect_host == NULL) {
3562 error("No forward host name.");
3563 return 0;
3564 }
3565 if (strlen(fwd->connect_host) >= NI_MAXHOST) {
3566 error("Forward host name too long.");
3567 return 0;
3568 }
3569 path = fwd->connect_host;
3570 port = fwd->connect_port;
3571 }
3572 break;
3573 case SSH_CHANNEL_RUNIX_LISTENER:
3574 path = fwd->listen_path;
3575 port = PORT_STREAMLOCAL;
3576 break;
3577 default:
3578 error("%s: unexpected channel type %d", __func__, type);
3579 return 0;
3580 }
3581
3582 if (fwd->listen_path == NULL) {
3583 error("No forward path name.");
3584 return 0;
3585 }
3586 if (strlen(fwd->listen_path) > sizeof(sunaddr.sun_path)) {
3587 error("Local listening path too long: %s", fwd->listen_path);
3588 return 0;
3589 }
3590
3591 debug3("%s: type %d path %s", __func__, type, fwd->listen_path);
3592
3593 /* Start a Unix domain listener. */
3594 omask = umask(fwd_opts->streamlocal_bind_mask);
3595 sock = unix_listener(fwd->listen_path, SSH_LISTEN_BACKLOG,
3596 fwd_opts->streamlocal_bind_unlink);
3597 umask(omask);
3598 if (sock < 0)
3599 return 0;
3600
3601 debug("Local forwarding listening on path %s.", fwd->listen_path);
3602
3603 /* Allocate a channel number for the socket. */
3604 c = channel_new(ssh, "unix listener", type, sock, sock, -1,
3605 CHAN_TCP_WINDOW_DEFAULT, CHAN_TCP_PACKET_DEFAULT,
3606 0, "unix listener", 1);
3607 c->path = xstrdup(path);
3608 c->host_port = port;
3609 c->listening_port = PORT_STREAMLOCAL;
3610 c->listening_addr = xstrdup(fwd->listen_path);
3611 return 1;
3612}

3614static int
3615channel_cancel_rport_listener_tcpip(struct ssh *ssh,
3616 const char *host, u_short port)
3617{
3618 u_int i;
3619 int found = 0;
3620
3621 for (i = 0; i < ssh->chanctxt->channels_alloc; i++) {
3622 Channel *c = ssh->chanctxt->channels[i];
3623 if (c == NULL || c->type != SSH_CHANNEL_RPORT_LISTENER)
3624 continue;
3625 if (strcmp(c->path, host) == 0 && c->listening_port == port) {
3626 debug2("%s: close channel %d", __func__, i);
3627 channel_free(ssh, c);
3628 found = 1;
3629 }
3630 }
3631
3632 return found;
3633}
3634
3635static int
3636channel_cancel_rport_listener_streamlocal(struct ssh *ssh, const char *path)
3637{
3638 u_int i;
3639 int found = 0;
3640
3641 for (i = 0; i < ssh->chanctxt->channels_alloc; i++) {
3642 Channel *c = ssh->chanctxt->channels[i];
3643 if (c == NULL || c->type != SSH_CHANNEL_RUNIX_LISTENER)
3644 continue;
3645 if (c->path == NULL)
3646 continue;
3647 if (strcmp(c->path, path) == 0) {
3648 debug2("%s: close channel %d", __func__, i);
3649 channel_free(ssh, c);
3650 found = 1;
3651 }
3652 }
3653
3654 return found;
3655}

3657int
3658channel_cancel_rport_listener(struct ssh *ssh, struct Forward *fwd)
3659{
3660 if (fwd->listen_path != NULL) {
3661 return channel_cancel_rport_listener_streamlocal(ssh,
3662 fwd->listen_path);
3663 } else {
3664 return channel_cancel_rport_listener_tcpip(ssh,
3665 fwd->listen_host, fwd->listen_port);
3666 }
3667}
3668
3669static int
3670channel_cancel_lport_listener_tcpip(struct ssh *ssh,
3671 const char *lhost, u_short lport, int cport,
3672 struct ForwardOptions *fwd_opts)
3673{
3674 u_int i;
3675 int found = 0;
3676 const char *addr = channel_fwd_bind_addr(ssh, lhost, NULL, 1, fwd_opts);
3677
3678 for (i = 0; i < ssh->chanctxt->channels_alloc; i++) {
3679 Channel *c = ssh->chanctxt->channels[i];
3680 if (c == NULL || c->type != SSH_CHANNEL_PORT_LISTENER)
3681 continue;
3682 if (c->listening_port != lport)
3683 continue;
3684 if (cport == CHANNEL_CANCEL_PORT_STATIC) {
3685 /* skip dynamic forwardings */
3686 if (c->host_port == 0)
3687 continue;
3688 } else {
3689 if (c->host_port != cport)
3690 continue;
3691 }
3692 if ((c->listening_addr == NULL && addr != NULL) ||
3693 (c->listening_addr != NULL && addr == NULL))
3694 continue;
3695 if (addr == NULL || strcmp(c->listening_addr, addr) == 0) {
3696 debug2("%s: close channel %d", __func__, i);
3697 channel_free(ssh, c);
3698 found = 1;
3699 }
3700 }
3701
3702 return found;
3703}
3704
3705static int
3706channel_cancel_lport_listener_streamlocal(struct ssh *ssh, const char *path)
3707{
3708 u_int i;
3709 int found = 0;
3710
3711 if (path == NULL) {
3712 error("%s: no path specified.", __func__);
3713 return 0;
3714 }
3715
3716 for (i = 0; i < ssh->chanctxt->channels_alloc; i++) {
3717 Channel *c = ssh->chanctxt->channels[i];
3718 if (c == NULL || c->type != SSH_CHANNEL_UNIX_LISTENER)
3719 continue;
3720 if (c->listening_addr == NULL)
3721 continue;
3722 if (strcmp(c->listening_addr, path) == 0) {
3723 debug2("%s: close channel %d", __func__, i);
3724 channel_free(ssh, c);
3725 found = 1;
3726 }
3727 }
3728
3729 return found;
3730}

3733channel_cancel_lport_listener(struct ssh *ssh,
3734 struct Forward *fwd, int cport, struct ForwardOptions *fwd_opts)
3735{
3736 if (fwd->listen_path != NULL) {
3737 return channel_cancel_lport_listener_streamlocal(ssh,
3738 fwd->listen_path);

3745/* protocol local port fwd, used by ssh */
3746int
3747channel_setup_local_fwd_listener(struct ssh *ssh,

3758
3759/* Matches a remote forwarding permission against a requested forwarding */
3760static int
3761remote_open_match(struct permission *allowed_open, struct Forward *fwd)
3762{
3763 int ret;
3764 char *lhost;
3765
3766 /* XXX add ACLs for streamlocal */
3767 if (fwd->listen_path != NULL)
3768 return 1;
3769
3770 if (fwd->listen_host == NULL || allowed_open->listen_host == NULL)
3771 return 0;
3772
3773 if (allowed_open->listen_port != FWD_PERMIT_ANY_PORT &&
3774 allowed_open->listen_port != fwd->listen_port)
3775 return 0;
3776
3777 /* Match hostnames case-insensitively */
3778 lhost = xstrdup(fwd->listen_host);
3779 lowercase(lhost);
3780 ret = match_pattern(lhost, allowed_open->listen_host);
3781 free(lhost);
3782
3783 return ret;
3784}
3785
3786/* Checks whether a requested remote forwarding is permitted */
3787static int
3788check_rfwd_permission(struct ssh *ssh, struct Forward *fwd)
3789{
3790 struct ssh_channels *sc = ssh->chanctxt;
3791 struct permission_set *pset = &sc->remote_perms;
3792 u_int i, permit, permit_adm = 1;
3793 struct permission *perm;
3794
3795 /* XXX apply GatewayPorts override before checking? */
3796
3797 permit = pset->all_permitted;
3798 if (!permit) {
3799 for (i = 0; i < pset->num_permitted_user; i++) {
3800 perm = &pset->permitted_user[i];
3801 if (remote_open_match(perm, fwd)) {
3802 permit = 1;
3803 break;
3804 }
3805 }
3806 }
3807
3808 if (pset->num_permitted_admin > 0) {
3809 permit_adm = 0;
3810 for (i = 0; i < pset->num_permitted_admin; i++) {
3811 perm = &pset->permitted_admin[i];
3812 if (remote_open_match(perm, fwd)) {
3813 permit_adm = 1;
3814 break;
3815 }
3816 }
3817 }
3818
3819 return permit && permit_adm;
3820}
3821
3822/* protocol v2 remote port fwd, used by sshd */
3823int
3824channel_setup_remote_fwd_listener(struct ssh *ssh, struct Forward *fwd,
3825 int *allocated_listen_port, struct ForwardOptions *fwd_opts)
3826{
3827 if (!check_rfwd_permission(ssh, fwd)) {
3828 ssh_packet_send_debug(ssh, "port forwarding refused");
3829 return 0;
3830 }
3831 if (fwd->listen_path != NULL) {
3832 return channel_setup_fwd_listener_streamlocal(ssh,
3833 SSH_CHANNEL_RUNIX_LISTENER, fwd, fwd_opts);
3834 } else {
3835 return channel_setup_fwd_listener_tcpip(ssh,
3836 SSH_CHANNEL_RPORT_LISTENER, fwd, allocated_listen_port,
3837 fwd_opts);
3838 }
3839}
3840
3841/*
3842 * Translate the requested rfwd listen host to something usable for
3843 * this server.
3844 */
3845static const char *
3846channel_rfwd_bind_host(const char *listen_host)
3847{
3848 if (listen_host == NULL) {
3849 return "localhost";
3850 } else if (*listen_host == '\0' || strcmp(listen_host, "*") == 0) {
3851 return "";
3852 } else
3853 return listen_host;
3854}
3855
3856/*
3857 * Initiate forwarding of connections to port "port" on remote host through
3858 * the secure channel to host:port from local side.
3859 * Returns handle (index) for updating the dynamic listen port with
3860 * channel_update_permission().
3861 */
3862int
3863channel_request_remote_forwarding(struct ssh *ssh, struct Forward *fwd)
3864{
3865 int r, success = 0, idx = -1;
3866 char *host_to_connect, *listen_host, *listen_path;
3867 int port_to_connect, listen_port;
3868
3869 /* Send the forward request to the remote side. */
3870 if (fwd->listen_path != NULL) {
3871 if ((r = sshpkt_start(ssh, SSH2_MSG_GLOBAL_REQUEST)) != 0 ||
3872 (r = sshpkt_put_cstring(ssh,
3873 "streamlocal-forward@openssh.com")) != 0 ||
3874 (r = sshpkt_put_u8(ssh, 1)) != 0 || /* want reply */
3875 (r = sshpkt_put_cstring(ssh, fwd->listen_path)) != 0 ||
3876 (r = sshpkt_send(ssh)) != 0 ||
3877 (r = ssh_packet_write_wait(ssh)) < 0)
3878 fatal("%s: request streamlocal: %s",
3879 __func__, ssh_err(r));
3880 } else {
3881 if ((r = sshpkt_start(ssh, SSH2_MSG_GLOBAL_REQUEST)) != 0 ||
3882 (r = sshpkt_put_cstring(ssh, "tcpip-forward")) != 0 ||
3883 (r = sshpkt_put_u8(ssh, 1)) != 0 || /* want reply */
3884 (r = sshpkt_put_cstring(ssh,
3885 channel_rfwd_bind_host(fwd->listen_host))) != 0 ||
3886 (r = sshpkt_put_u32(ssh, fwd->listen_port)) != 0 ||
3887 (r = sshpkt_send(ssh)) != 0 ||
3888 (r = ssh_packet_write_wait(ssh)) < 0)
3889 fatal("%s: request tcpip-forward: %s",
3890 __func__, ssh_err(r));
3891 }
3892 /* Assume that server accepts the request */
3893 success = 1;
3894 if (success) {
3895 /* Record that connection to this host/port is permitted. */
3896 host_to_connect = listen_host = listen_path = NULL;
3897 port_to_connect = listen_port = 0;
3898 if (fwd->connect_path != NULL) {
3899 host_to_connect = xstrdup(fwd->connect_path);
3900 port_to_connect = PORT_STREAMLOCAL;
3901 } else {
3902 host_to_connect = xstrdup(fwd->connect_host);
3903 port_to_connect = fwd->connect_port;
3904 }
3905 if (fwd->listen_path != NULL) {
3906 listen_path = xstrdup(fwd->listen_path);
3907 listen_port = PORT_STREAMLOCAL;
3908 } else {
3909 if (fwd->listen_host != NULL)
3910 listen_host = xstrdup(fwd->listen_host);
3911 listen_port = fwd->listen_port;
3912 }
3913 idx = permission_set_add(ssh, FORWARD_USER, FORWARD_LOCAL,
3914 host_to_connect, port_to_connect,
3915 listen_host, listen_path, listen_port, NULL);
3916 }
3917 return idx;
3918}
3919
3920static int
3921open_match(struct permission *allowed_open, const char *requestedhost,
3922 int requestedport)
3923{
3924 if (allowed_open->host_to_connect == NULL)
3925 return 0;
3926 if (allowed_open->port_to_connect != FWD_PERMIT_ANY_PORT &&
3927 allowed_open->port_to_connect != requestedport)
3928 return 0;
3929 if (strcmp(allowed_open->host_to_connect, FWD_PERMIT_ANY_HOST) != 0 &&
3930 strcmp(allowed_open->host_to_connect, requestedhost) != 0)
3931 return 0;
3932 return 1;
3933}
3934
3935/*
3936 * Note that in the listen host/port case
3937 * we don't support FWD_PERMIT_ANY_PORT and
3938 * need to translate between the configured-host (listen_host)
3939 * and what we've sent to the remote server (channel_rfwd_bind_host)
3940 */
3941static int
3942open_listen_match_tcpip(struct permission *allowed_open,
3943 const char *requestedhost, u_short requestedport, int translate)
3944{
3945 const char *allowed_host;
3946
3947 if (allowed_open->host_to_connect == NULL)
3948 return 0;
3949 if (allowed_open->listen_port != requestedport)
3950 return 0;
3951 if (!translate && allowed_open->listen_host == NULL &&
3952 requestedhost == NULL)
3953 return 1;
3954 allowed_host = translate ?
3955 channel_rfwd_bind_host(allowed_open->listen_host) :
3956 allowed_open->listen_host;
3957 if (allowed_host == NULL || requestedhost == NULL ||
3958 strcmp(allowed_host, requestedhost) != 0)
3959 return 0;
3960 return 1;
3961}
3962
3963static int
3964open_listen_match_streamlocal(struct permission *allowed_open,
3965 const char *requestedpath)
3966{
3967 if (allowed_open->host_to_connect == NULL)
3968 return 0;
3969 if (allowed_open->listen_port != PORT_STREAMLOCAL)
3970 return 0;
3971 if (allowed_open->listen_path == NULL ||
3972 strcmp(allowed_open->listen_path, requestedpath) != 0)
3973 return 0;
3974 return 1;
3975}
3976
3977/*
3978 * Request cancellation of remote forwarding of connection host:port from
3979 * local side.
3980 */
3981static int
3982channel_request_rforward_cancel_tcpip(struct ssh *ssh,
3983 const char *host, u_short port)
3984{
3985 struct ssh_channels *sc = ssh->chanctxt;
3986 struct permission_set *pset = &sc->local_perms;
3987 int r;
3988 u_int i;
3989 struct permission *perm;
3990
3991 for (i = 0; i < pset->num_permitted_user; i++) {
3992 perm = &pset->permitted_user[i];
3993 if (open_listen_match_tcpip(perm, host, port, 0))
3994 break;
3995 perm = NULL;
3996 }
3997 if (perm == NULL) {
3998 debug("%s: requested forward not found", __func__);
3999 return -1;
4000 }
4001 if ((r = sshpkt_start(ssh, SSH2_MSG_GLOBAL_REQUEST)) != 0 ||
4002 (r = sshpkt_put_cstring(ssh, "cancel-tcpip-forward")) != 0 ||
4003 (r = sshpkt_put_u8(ssh, 0)) != 0 || /* want reply */
4004 (r = sshpkt_put_cstring(ssh, channel_rfwd_bind_host(host))) != 0 ||
4005 (r = sshpkt_put_u32(ssh, port)) != 0 ||
4006 (r = sshpkt_send(ssh)) != 0)
4007 fatal("%s: send cancel: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
4008
4009 fwd_perm_clear(perm); /* unregister */
4010
4011 return 0;
4012}
4013
4014/*
4015 * Request cancellation of remote forwarding of Unix domain socket
4016 * path from local side.
4017 */
4018static int
4019channel_request_rforward_cancel_streamlocal(struct ssh *ssh, const char *path)
4020{
4021 struct ssh_channels *sc = ssh->chanctxt;
4022 struct permission_set *pset = &sc->local_perms;
4023 int r;
4024 u_int i;
4025 struct permission *perm;
4026
4027 for (i = 0; i < pset->num_permitted_user; i++) {
4028 perm = &pset->permitted_user[i];
4029 if (open_listen_match_streamlocal(perm, path))
4030 break;
4031 perm = NULL;
4032 }
4033 if (perm == NULL) {
4034 debug("%s: requested forward not found", __func__);
4035 return -1;
4036 }
4037 if ((r = sshpkt_start(ssh, SSH2_MSG_GLOBAL_REQUEST)) != 0 ||
4038 (r = sshpkt_put_cstring(ssh,
4039 "cancel-streamlocal-forward@openssh.com")) != 0 ||
4040 (r = sshpkt_put_u8(ssh, 0)) != 0 || /* want reply */
4041 (r = sshpkt_put_cstring(ssh, path)) != 0 ||
4042 (r = sshpkt_send(ssh)) != 0)
4043 fatal("%s: send cancel: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
4044
4045 fwd_perm_clear(perm); /* unregister */
4046
4047 return 0;
4048}
4049
4050/*
4051 * Request cancellation of remote forwarding of a connection from local side.
4052 */
4053int
4054channel_request_rforward_cancel(struct ssh *ssh, struct Forward *fwd)
4055{
4056 if (fwd->listen_path != NULL) {
4057 return channel_request_rforward_cancel_streamlocal(ssh,
4058 fwd->listen_path);
4059 } else {
4060 return channel_request_rforward_cancel_tcpip(ssh,
4061 fwd->listen_host,
4062 fwd->listen_port ? fwd->listen_port : fwd->allocated_port);
4063 }
4064}
4065
4066/*
4067 * Permits opening to any host/port if permitted_user[] is empty. This is
4068 * usually called by the server, because the user could connect to any port
4069 * anyway, and the server has no way to know but to trust the client anyway.
4070 */
4071void
4072channel_permit_all(struct ssh *ssh, int where)
4073{
4074 struct permission_set *pset = permission_set_get(ssh, where);
4075
4076 if (pset->num_permitted_user == 0)
4077 pset->all_permitted = 1;
4078}
4079
4080/*
4081 * Permit the specified host/port for forwarding.
4082 */
4083void
4084channel_add_permission(struct ssh *ssh, int who, int where,
4085 char *host, int port)
4086{
4087 int local = where == FORWARD_LOCAL;
4088 struct permission_set *pset = permission_set_get(ssh, where);
4089
4090 debug("allow %s forwarding to host %s port %d",
4091 fwd_ident(who, where), host, port);
4092 /*
4093 * Remote forwards set listen_host/port, local forwards set
4094 * host/port_to_connect.
4095 */
4096 permission_set_add(ssh, who, where,
4097 local ? host : 0, local ? port : 0,
4098 local ? NULL : host, NULL, local ? 0 : port, NULL);
4099 pset->all_permitted = 0;
4100}
4101
4102/*
4103 * Administratively disable forwarding.
4104 */
4105void
4106channel_disable_admin(struct ssh *ssh, int where)
4107{
4108 channel_clear_permission(ssh, FORWARD_ADM, where);
4109 permission_set_add(ssh, FORWARD_ADM, where,
4110 NULL, 0, NULL, NULL, 0, NULL);
4111}
4112
4113/*
4114 * Clear a list of permitted opens.
4115 */
4116void
4117channel_clear_permission(struct ssh *ssh, int who, int where)
4118{
4119 struct permission **permp;
4120 u_int *npermp;
4121
4122 permission_set_get_array(ssh, who, where, &permp, &npermp);
4123 *permp = xrecallocarray(*permp, *npermp, 0, sizeof(**permp));
4124 *npermp = 0;
4125}
4126
4127/*
4128 * Update the listen port for a dynamic remote forward, after
4129 * the actual 'newport' has been allocated. If 'newport' < 0 is
4130 * passed then they entry will be invalidated.
4131 */
4132void
4133channel_update_permission(struct ssh *ssh, int idx, int newport)
4134{
4135 struct permission_set *pset = &ssh->chanctxt->local_perms;
4136
4137 if (idx < 0 || (u_int)idx >= pset->num_permitted_user) {
4138 debug("%s: index out of range: %d num_permitted_user %d",
4139 __func__, idx, pset->num_permitted_user);
4140 return;
4141 }
4142 debug("%s allowed port %d for forwarding to host %s port %d",
4143 newport > 0 ? "Updating" : "Removing",
4144 newport,
4145 pset->permitted_user[idx].host_to_connect,
4146 pset->permitted_user[idx].port_to_connect);
4147 if (newport <= 0)
4148 fwd_perm_clear(&pset->permitted_user[idx]);
4149 else {
4150 pset->permitted_user[idx].listen_port =
4151 (datafellows & SSH_BUG_DYNAMIC_RPORT) ? 0 : newport;
4152 }
4153}
4154
4155/* returns port number, FWD_PERMIT_ANY_PORT or -1 on error */
4156int
4157permitopen_port(const char *p)
4158{
4159 int port;
4160
4161 if (strcmp(p, "*") == 0)
4162 return FWD_PERMIT_ANY_PORT;
4163 if ((port = a2port(p)) > 0)
4164 return port;
4165 return -1;
4166}
4167
4168/* Try to start non-blocking connect to next host in cctx list */
4169static int
4170connect_next(struct channel_connect *cctx)
4171{
4172 int sock, saved_errno;
4173 struct sockaddr_un *sunaddr;
4174 char ntop[NI_MAXHOST];
4175 char strport[MAXIMUM(NI_MAXSERV, sizeof(sunaddr->sun_path))];
4176
4177 for (; cctx->ai; cctx->ai = cctx->ai->ai_next) {
4178 switch (cctx->ai->ai_family) {
4179 case AF_UNIX:
4180 /* unix:pathname instead of host:port */
4181 sunaddr = (struct sockaddr_un *)cctx->ai->ai_addr;
4182 strlcpy(ntop, "unix", sizeof(ntop));
4183 strlcpy(strport, sunaddr->sun_path, sizeof(strport));
4184 break;
4185 case AF_INET:
4186 case AF_INET6:
4187 if (getnameinfo(cctx->ai->ai_addr, cctx->ai->ai_addrlen,
4188 ntop, sizeof(ntop), strport, sizeof(strport),
4189 NI_NUMERICHOST|NI_NUMERICSERV) != 0) {
4190 error("connect_next: getnameinfo failed");
4191 continue;
4192 }
4193 break;
4194 default:
4195 continue;
4196 }
4197 if ((sock = socket(cctx->ai->ai_family, cctx->ai->ai_socktype,
4198 cctx->ai->ai_protocol)) == -1) {
4199 if (cctx->ai->ai_next == NULL)
4200 error("socket: %.100s", strerror(errno));
4201 else
4202 verbose("socket: %.100s", strerror(errno));
4203 continue;
4204 }
4205 if (set_nonblock(sock) == -1)
4206 fatal("%s: set_nonblock(%d)", __func__, sock);
4207 if (connect(sock, cctx->ai->ai_addr,
4208 cctx->ai->ai_addrlen) == -1 && errno != EINPROGRESS) {
4209 debug("connect_next: host %.100s ([%.100s]:%s): "
4210 "%.100s", cctx->host, ntop, strport,
4211 strerror(errno));
4212 saved_errno = errno;
4213 close(sock);
4214 errno = saved_errno;
4215 continue; /* fail -- try next */
4216 }
4217 if (cctx->ai->ai_family != AF_UNIX)
4218 set_nodelay(sock);
4219 debug("connect_next: host %.100s ([%.100s]:%s) "
4220 "in progress, fd=%d", cctx->host, ntop, strport, sock);
4221 cctx->ai = cctx->ai->ai_next;
4222 return sock;
4223 }
4224 return -1;
4225}
4226
4227static void
4228channel_connect_ctx_free(struct channel_connect *cctx)
4229{
4230 free(cctx->host);
4231 if (cctx->aitop) {
4232 if (cctx->aitop->ai_family == AF_UNIX)
4233 free(cctx->aitop);
4234 else
4235 freeaddrinfo(cctx->aitop);
4236 }
4237 memset(cctx, 0, sizeof(*cctx));
4238}
4239
4240/*
4241 * Return connecting socket to remote host:port or local socket path,
4242 * passing back the failure reason if appropriate.
4243 */
4244static int
4245connect_to_helper(struct ssh *ssh, const char *name, int port, int socktype,
4246 const char *ctype, const char *rname, struct channel_connect *cctx,
4247 int *reason, const char **errmsg)
4248{
4249 struct addrinfo hints;
4250 int gaierr;
4251 int sock = -1;
4252 char strport[NI_MAXSERV];
4253
4254 if (port == PORT_STREAMLOCAL) {
4255 struct sockaddr_un *sunaddr;
4256 struct addrinfo *ai;
4257
4258 if (strlen(name) > sizeof(sunaddr->sun_path)) {
4259 error("%.100s: %.100s", name, strerror(ENAMETOOLONG));
4260 return -1;
4261 }
4262
4263 /*
4264 * Fake up a struct addrinfo for AF_UNIX connections.
4265 * channel_connect_ctx_free() must check ai_family
4266 * and use free() not freeaddirinfo() for AF_UNIX.
4267 */
4268 ai = xmalloc(sizeof(*ai) + sizeof(*sunaddr));
4269 memset(ai, 0, sizeof(*ai) + sizeof(*sunaddr));
4270 ai->ai_addr = (struct sockaddr *)(ai + 1);
4271 ai->ai_addrlen = sizeof(*sunaddr);
4272 ai->ai_family = AF_UNIX;
4273 ai->ai_socktype = socktype;
4274 ai->ai_protocol = PF_UNSPEC;
4275 sunaddr = (struct sockaddr_un *)ai->ai_addr;
4276 sunaddr->sun_family = AF_UNIX;
4277 strlcpy(sunaddr->sun_path, name, sizeof(sunaddr->sun_path));
4278 cctx->aitop = ai;
4279 } else {
4280 memset(&hints, 0, sizeof(hints));
4281 hints.ai_family = ssh->chanctxt->IPv4or6;
4282 hints.ai_socktype = socktype;
4283 snprintf(strport, sizeof strport, "%d", port);
4284 if ((gaierr = getaddrinfo(name, strport, &hints, &cctx->aitop))
4285 != 0) {
4286 if (errmsg != NULL)
4287 *errmsg = ssh_gai_strerror(gaierr);
4288 if (reason != NULL)
4289 *reason = SSH2_OPEN_CONNECT_FAILED;
4290 error("connect_to %.100s: unknown host (%s)", name,
4291 ssh_gai_strerror(gaierr));
4292 return -1;
4293 }
4294 }
4295
4296 cctx->host = xstrdup(name);
4297 cctx->port = port;
4298 cctx->ai = cctx->aitop;
4299
4300 if ((sock = connect_next(cctx)) == -1) {
4301 error("connect to %.100s port %d failed: %s",
4302 name, port, strerror(errno));
4303 return -1;
4304 }
4305
4306 return sock;
4307}
4308
4309/* Return CONNECTING channel to remote host:port or local socket path */
4310static Channel *
4311connect_to(struct ssh *ssh, const char *host, int port,
4312 const char *ctype, const char *rname)
4313{
4314 struct channel_connect cctx;
4315 Channel *c;
4316 int sock;
4317
4318 memset(&cctx, 0, sizeof(cctx));
4319 sock = connect_to_helper(ssh, host, port, SOCK_STREAM, ctype, rname,
4320 &cctx, NULL, NULL);
4321 if (sock == -1) {
4322 channel_connect_ctx_free(&cctx);
4323 return NULL;
4324 }
4325 c = channel_new(ssh, ctype, SSH_CHANNEL_CONNECTING, sock, sock, -1,
4326 CHAN_TCP_WINDOW_DEFAULT, CHAN_TCP_PACKET_DEFAULT, 0, rname, 1);
4327 c->host_port = port;
4328 c->path = xstrdup(host);
4329 c->connect_ctx = cctx;
4330
4331 return c;
4332}
4333
4334/*
4335 * returns either the newly connected channel or the downstream channel
4336 * that needs to deal with this connection.
4337 */
4338Channel *
4339channel_connect_by_listen_address(struct ssh *ssh, const char *listen_host,
4340 u_short listen_port, const char *ctype, const char *rname)
4341{
4342 struct ssh_channels *sc = ssh->chanctxt;
4343 struct permission_set *pset = &sc->local_perms;
4344 u_int i;
4345 struct permission *perm;
4346
4347 for (i = 0; i < pset->num_permitted_user; i++) {
4348 perm = &pset->permitted_user[i];
4349 if (open_listen_match_tcpip(perm,
4350 listen_host, listen_port, 1)) {
4351 if (perm->downstream)
4352 return perm->downstream;
4353 if (perm->port_to_connect == 0)
4354 return rdynamic_connect_prepare(ssh,
4355 ctype, rname);
4356 return connect_to(ssh,
4357 perm->host_to_connect, perm->port_to_connect,
4358 ctype, rname);
4359 }
4360 }
4361 error("WARNING: Server requests forwarding for unknown listen_port %d",
4362 listen_port);
4363 return NULL;
4364}
4365
4366Channel *
4367channel_connect_by_listen_path(struct ssh *ssh, const char *path,
4368 const char *ctype, const char *rname)
4369{
4370 struct ssh_channels *sc = ssh->chanctxt;
4371 struct permission_set *pset = &sc->local_perms;
4372 u_int i;
4373 struct permission *perm;
4374
4375 for (i = 0; i < pset->num_permitted_user; i++) {
4376 perm = &pset->permitted_user[i];
4377 if (open_listen_match_streamlocal(perm, path)) {
4378 return connect_to(ssh,
4379 perm->host_to_connect, perm->port_to_connect,
4380 ctype, rname);
4381 }
4382 }
4383 error("WARNING: Server requests forwarding for unknown path %.100s",
4384 path);
4385 return NULL;
4386}
4387
4388/* Check if connecting to that port is permitted and connect. */
4389Channel *
4390channel_connect_to_port(struct ssh *ssh, const char *host, u_short port,
4391 const char *ctype, const char *rname, int *reason, const char **errmsg)
4392{
4393 struct ssh_channels *sc = ssh->chanctxt;
4394 struct permission_set *pset = &sc->local_perms;
4395 struct channel_connect cctx;
4396 Channel *c;
4397 u_int i, permit, permit_adm = 1;
4398 int sock;
4399 struct permission *perm;
4400
4401 permit = pset->all_permitted;
4402 if (!permit) {
4403 for (i = 0; i < pset->num_permitted_user; i++) {
4404 perm = &pset->permitted_user[i];
4405 if (open_match(perm, host, port)) {
4406 permit = 1;
4407 break;
4408 }
4409 }
4410 }
4411
4412 if (pset->num_permitted_admin > 0) {
4413 permit_adm = 0;
4414 for (i = 0; i < pset->num_permitted_admin; i++) {
4415 perm = &pset->permitted_admin[i];
4416 if (open_match(perm, host, port)) {
4417 permit_adm = 1;
4418 break;
4419 }
4420 }
4421 }
4422
4423 if (!permit || !permit_adm) {
4424 logit("Received request to connect to host %.100s port %d, "
4425 "but the request was denied.", host, port);
4426 if (reason != NULL)
4427 *reason = SSH2_OPEN_ADMINISTRATIVELY_PROHIBITED;
4428 return NULL;
4429 }
4430
4431 memset(&cctx, 0, sizeof(cctx));
4432 sock = connect_to_helper(ssh, host, port, SOCK_STREAM, ctype, rname,
4433 &cctx, reason, errmsg);
4434 if (sock == -1) {
4435 channel_connect_ctx_free(&cctx);
4436 return NULL;
4437 }
4438
4439 c = channel_new(ssh, ctype, SSH_CHANNEL_CONNECTING, sock, sock, -1,
4440 CHAN_TCP_WINDOW_DEFAULT, CHAN_TCP_PACKET_DEFAULT, 0, rname, 1);
4441 c->host_port = port;
4442 c->path = xstrdup(host);
4443 c->connect_ctx = cctx;
4444
4445 return c;
4446}
4447
4448/* Check if connecting to that path is permitted and connect. */
4449Channel *
4450channel_connect_to_path(struct ssh *ssh, const char *path, const char *ctype,
4451 const char *rname)
4452{
4453 struct ssh_channels *sc = ssh->chanctxt;
4454 struct permission_set *pset = &sc->local_perms;
4455 u_int i, permit, permit_adm = 1;
4456 struct permission *perm;
4457
4458 permit = pset->all_permitted;
4459 if (!permit) {
4460 for (i = 0; i < pset->num_permitted_user; i++) {
4461 perm = &pset->permitted_user[i];
4462 if (open_match(perm, path, PORT_STREAMLOCAL)) {
4463 permit = 1;
4464 break;
4465 }
4466 }
4467 }
4468
4469 if (pset->num_permitted_admin > 0) {
4470 permit_adm = 0;
4471 for (i = 0; i < pset->num_permitted_admin; i++) {
4472 perm = &pset->permitted_admin[i];
4473 if (open_match(perm, path, PORT_STREAMLOCAL)) {
4474 permit_adm = 1;
4475 break;
4476 }
4477 }
4478 }
4479
4480 if (!permit || !permit_adm) {
4481 logit("Received request to connect to path %.100s, "
4482 "but the request was denied.", path);
4483 return NULL;
4484 }
4485 return connect_to(ssh, path, PORT_STREAMLOCAL, ctype, rname);
4486}
4487
4488void
4489channel_send_window_changes(struct ssh *ssh)
4490{
4491 struct ssh_channels *sc = ssh->chanctxt;
4492 struct winsize ws;
4493 int r;
4494 u_int i;
4495
4496 for (i = 0; i < sc->channels_alloc; i++) {
4497 if (sc->channels[i] == NULL || !sc->channels[i]->client_tty ||
4498 sc->channels[i]->type != SSH_CHANNEL_OPEN)
4499 continue;
4500 if (ioctl(sc->channels[i]->rfd, TIOCGWINSZ, &ws) < 0)
4501 continue;
4502 channel_request_start(ssh, i, "window-change", 0);
4503 if ((r = sshpkt_put_u32(ssh, (u_int)ws.ws_col)) != 0 ||
4504 (r = sshpkt_put_u32(ssh, (u_int)ws.ws_row)) != 0 ||
4505 (r = sshpkt_put_u32(ssh, (u_int)ws.ws_xpixel)) != 0 ||
4506 (r = sshpkt_put_u32(ssh, (u_int)ws.ws_ypixel)) != 0 ||
4507 (r = sshpkt_send(ssh)) != 0)
4508 fatal("%s: channel %u: send window-change: %s",
4509 __func__, i, ssh_err(r));
4510 }
4511}
4512
4513/* Return RDYNAMIC_OPEN channel: channel allows SOCKS, but is not connected */
4514static Channel *
4515rdynamic_connect_prepare(struct ssh *ssh, const char *ctype, const char *rname)
4516{
4517 Channel *c;
4518 int r;
4519
4520 c = channel_new(ssh, ctype, SSH_CHANNEL_RDYNAMIC_OPEN, -1, -1, -1,
4521 CHAN_TCP_WINDOW_DEFAULT, CHAN_TCP_PACKET_DEFAULT, 0, rname, 1);
4522 c->host_port = 0;
4523 c->path = NULL;
4524
4525 /*
4526 * We need to open the channel before we have a FD,
4527 * so that we can get SOCKS header from peer.
4528 */
4529 if ((r = sshpkt_start(ssh, SSH2_MSG_CHANNEL_OPEN_CONFIRMATION)) != 0 ||
4530 (r = sshpkt_put_u32(ssh, c->remote_id)) != 0 ||
4531 (r = sshpkt_put_u32(ssh, c->self)) != 0 ||
4532 (r = sshpkt_put_u32(ssh, c->local_window)) != 0 ||
4533 (r = sshpkt_put_u32(ssh, c->local_maxpacket)) != 0) {
4534 fatal("%s: channel %i: confirm: %s", __func__,
4535 c->self, ssh_err(r));
4536 }
4537 return c;
4538}
4539
4540/* Return CONNECTING socket to remote host:port or local socket path */
4541static int
4542rdynamic_connect_finish(struct ssh *ssh, Channel *c)
4543{
4544 struct channel_connect cctx;
4545 int sock;
4546
4547 memset(&cctx, 0, sizeof(cctx));
4548 sock = connect_to_helper(ssh, c->path, c->host_port, SOCK_STREAM, NULL,
4549 NULL, &cctx, NULL, NULL);
4550 if (sock == -1)
4551 channel_connect_ctx_free(&cctx);
4552 else {
4553 /* similar to SSH_CHANNEL_CONNECTING but we've already sent the open */
4554 c->type = SSH_CHANNEL_RDYNAMIC_FINISH;
4555 c->connect_ctx = cctx;
4556 channel_register_fds(ssh, c, sock, sock, -1, 0, 1, 0);
4557 }
4558 return sock;
4559}
4560
4561/* -- X11 forwarding */
4562
4563/*
4564 * Creates an internet domain socket for listening for X11 connections.
4565 * Returns 0 and a suitable display number for the DISPLAY variable
4566 * stored in display_numberp , or -1 if an error occurs.
4567 */
4568int
4569x11_create_display_inet(struct ssh *ssh, int x11_display_offset,
4570 int x11_use_localhost, int single_connection,
4571 u_int *display_numberp, int **chanids)
4572{
4573 Channel *nc = NULL;
4574 int display_number, sock;
4575 u_short port;
4576 struct addrinfo hints, *ai, *aitop;
4577 char strport[NI_MAXSERV];
4578 int gaierr, n, num_socks = 0, socks[NUM_SOCKS];
4579
4580 if (chanids == NULL)
4581 return -1;
4582
4583 for (display_number = x11_display_offset;
4584 display_number < MAX_DISPLAYS;
4585 display_number++) {
4586 port = 6000 + display_number;
4587 memset(&hints, 0, sizeof(hints));
4588 hints.ai_family = ssh->chanctxt->IPv4or6;
4589 hints.ai_flags = x11_use_localhost ? 0: AI_PASSIVE;
4590 hints.ai_socktype = SOCK_STREAM;
4591 snprintf(strport, sizeof strport, "%d", port);
4592 if ((gaierr = getaddrinfo(NULL, strport,
4593 &hints, &aitop)) != 0) {
4594 error("getaddrinfo: %.100s", ssh_gai_strerror(gaierr));
4595 return -1;
4596 }
4597 for (ai = aitop; ai; ai = ai->ai_next) {
4598 if (ai->ai_family != AF_INET &&
4599 ai->ai_family != AF_INET6)
4600 continue;
4601 sock = socket(ai->ai_family, ai->ai_socktype,
4602 ai->ai_protocol);
4603 if (sock < 0) {
4604 error("socket: %.100s", strerror(errno));
4605 freeaddrinfo(aitop);
4606 return -1;
4607 }
4608 set_reuseaddr(sock);
4609 if (bind(sock, ai->ai_addr, ai->ai_addrlen) < 0) {
4610 debug2("%s: bind port %d: %.100s", __func__,
4611 port, strerror(errno));
4612 close(sock);
4613 for (n = 0; n < num_socks; n++)
4614 close(socks[n]);
4615 num_socks = 0;
4616 break;
4617 }
4618 socks[num_socks++] = sock;
4619 if (num_socks == NUM_SOCKS)
4620 break;
4621 }
4622 freeaddrinfo(aitop);
4623 if (num_socks > 0)
4624 break;
4625 }
4626 if (display_number >= MAX_DISPLAYS) {
4627 error("Failed to allocate internet-domain X11 display socket.");
4628 return -1;
4629 }
4630 /* Start listening for connections on the socket. */
4631 for (n = 0; n < num_socks; n++) {
4632 sock = socks[n];
4633 if (listen(sock, SSH_LISTEN_BACKLOG) < 0) {
4634 error("listen: %.100s", strerror(errno));
4635 close(sock);
4636 return -1;
4637 }
4638 }
4639
4640 /* Allocate a channel for each socket. */
4641 *chanids = xcalloc(num_socks + 1, sizeof(**chanids));
4642 for (n = 0; n < num_socks; n++) {
4643 sock = socks[n];
4644 /* Is this really necassary? */
4645 if (hpn_disabled)
4646 nc = channel_new(ssh, "x11 listener",
4647 SSH_CHANNEL_X11_LISTENER, sock, sock, -1,
4648 CHAN_X11_WINDOW_DEFAULT, CHAN_X11_PACKET_DEFAULT,
4649 0, "X11 inet listener", 1);
4650 else
4651 nc = channel_new(ssh, "x11 listener",
4652 SSH_CHANNEL_X11_LISTENER, sock, sock, -1,
4653 hpn_buffer_size, CHAN_X11_PACKET_DEFAULT,
4654 0, "X11 inet listener", 1);
4655 nc->single_connection = single_connection;
4656 (*chanids)[n] = nc->self;
4657 }
4658 (*chanids)[n] = -1;
4659
4660 /* Return the display number for the DISPLAY environment variable. */
4661 *display_numberp = display_number;
4662 return 0;
4663}
4664
4665static int
4666connect_local_xsocket(u_int dnr)
4667{
4668 int sock;
4669 struct sockaddr_un addr;
4670
4671 sock = socket(AF_UNIX, SOCK_STREAM, 0);
4672 if (sock < 0)
4673 error("socket: %.100s", strerror(errno));
4674 memset(&addr, 0, sizeof(addr));
4675 addr.sun_family = AF_UNIX;
4676 snprintf(addr.sun_path, sizeof addr.sun_path, _PATH_UNIX_X, dnr);
4677 if (connect(sock, (struct sockaddr *)&addr, sizeof(addr)) == 0)
4678 return sock;
4679 close(sock);
4680 error("connect %.100s: %.100s", addr.sun_path, strerror(errno));
4681 return -1;
4682}
4683
4684int
4685x11_connect_display(struct ssh *ssh)
4686{
4687 u_int display_number;
4688 const char *display;
4689 char buf[1024], *cp;
4690 struct addrinfo hints, *ai, *aitop;
4691 char strport[NI_MAXSERV];
4692 int gaierr, sock = 0;
4693
4694 /* Try to open a socket for the local X server. */
4695 display = getenv("DISPLAY");
4696 if (!display) {
4697 error("DISPLAY not set.");
4698 return -1;
4699 }
4700 /*
4701 * Now we decode the value of the DISPLAY variable and make a
4702 * connection to the real X server.
4703 */
4704
4705 /*
4706 * Check if it is a unix domain socket. Unix domain displays are in
4707 * one of the following formats: unix:d[.s], :d[.s], ::d[.s]
4708 */
4709 if (strncmp(display, "unix:", 5) == 0 ||
4710 display[0] == ':') {
4711 /* Connect to the unix domain socket. */
4712 if (sscanf(strrchr(display, ':') + 1, "%u",
4713 &display_number) != 1) {
4714 error("Could not parse display number from DISPLAY: "
4715 "%.100s", display);
4716 return -1;
4717 }
4718 /* Create a socket. */
4719 sock = connect_local_xsocket(display_number);
4720 if (sock < 0)
4721 return -1;
4722
4723 /* OK, we now have a connection to the display. */
4724 return sock;
4725 }
4726 /*
4727 * Connect to an inet socket. The DISPLAY value is supposedly
4728 * hostname:d[.s], where hostname may also be numeric IP address.
4729 */
4730 strlcpy(buf, display, sizeof(buf));
4731 cp = strchr(buf, ':');
4732 if (!cp) {
4733 error("Could not find ':' in DISPLAY: %.100s", display);
4734 return -1;
4735 }
4736 *cp = 0;
4737 /*
4738 * buf now contains the host name. But first we parse the
4739 * display number.
4740 */
4741 if (sscanf(cp + 1, "%u", &display_number) != 1) {
4742 error("Could not parse display number from DISPLAY: %.100s",
4743 display);
4744 return -1;
4745 }
4746
4747 /* Look up the host address */
4748 memset(&hints, 0, sizeof(hints));
4749 hints.ai_family = ssh->chanctxt->IPv4or6;
4750 hints.ai_socktype = SOCK_STREAM;
4751 snprintf(strport, sizeof strport, "%u", 6000 + display_number);
4752 if ((gaierr = getaddrinfo(buf, strport, &hints, &aitop)) != 0) {
4753 error("%.100s: unknown host. (%s)", buf,
4754 ssh_gai_strerror(gaierr));
4755 return -1;
4756 }
4757 for (ai = aitop; ai; ai = ai->ai_next) {
4758 /* Create a socket. */
4759 sock = socket(ai->ai_family, ai->ai_socktype, ai->ai_protocol);
4760 if (sock < 0) {
4761 debug2("socket: %.100s", strerror(errno));
4762 continue;
4763 }
4764 /* Connect it to the display. */
4765 if (connect(sock, ai->ai_addr, ai->ai_addrlen) < 0) {
4766 debug2("connect %.100s port %u: %.100s", buf,
4767 6000 + display_number, strerror(errno));
4768 close(sock);
4769 continue;
4770 }
4771 /* Success */
4772 break;
4773 }
4774 freeaddrinfo(aitop);
4775 if (!ai) {
4776 error("connect %.100s port %u: %.100s", buf,
4777 6000 + display_number, strerror(errno));
4778 return -1;
4779 }
4780 set_nodelay(sock);
4781 return sock;
4782}
4783
4784/*
4785 * Requests forwarding of X11 connections, generates fake authentication
4786 * data, and enables authentication spoofing.
4787 * This should be called in the client only.
4788 */
4789void
4790x11_request_forwarding_with_spoofing(struct ssh *ssh, int client_session_id,
4791 const char *disp, const char *proto, const char *data, int want_reply)
4792{
4793 struct ssh_channels *sc = ssh->chanctxt;
4794 u_int data_len = (u_int) strlen(data) / 2;
4795 u_int i, value;
4796 const char *cp;
4797 char *new_data;
4798 int r, screen_number;
4799
4800 if (sc->x11_saved_display == NULL)
4801 sc->x11_saved_display = xstrdup(disp);
4802 else if (strcmp(disp, sc->x11_saved_display) != 0) {
4803 error("x11_request_forwarding_with_spoofing: different "
4804 "$DISPLAY already forwarded");
4805 return;
4806 }
4807
4808 cp = strchr(disp, ':');
4809 if (cp)
4810 cp = strchr(cp, '.');
4811 if (cp)
4812 screen_number = (u_int)strtonum(cp + 1, 0, 400, NULL);
4813 else
4814 screen_number = 0;
4815
4816 if (sc->x11_saved_proto == NULL) {
4817 /* Save protocol name. */
4818 sc->x11_saved_proto = xstrdup(proto);
4819
4820 /* Extract real authentication data. */
4821 sc->x11_saved_data = xmalloc(data_len);
4822 for (i = 0; i < data_len; i++) {
4823 if (sscanf(data + 2 * i, "%2x", &value) != 1)
4824 fatal("x11_request_forwarding: bad "
4825 "authentication data: %.100s", data);
4826 sc->x11_saved_data[i] = value;
4827 }
4828 sc->x11_saved_data_len = data_len;
4829
4830 /* Generate fake data of the same length. */
4831 sc->x11_fake_data = xmalloc(data_len);
4832 arc4random_buf(sc->x11_fake_data, data_len);
4833 sc->x11_fake_data_len = data_len;
4834 }
4835
4836 /* Convert the fake data into hex. */
4837 new_data = tohex(sc->x11_fake_data, data_len);
4838
4839 /* Send the request packet. */
4840 channel_request_start(ssh, client_session_id, "x11-req", want_reply);
4841 if ((r = sshpkt_put_u8(ssh, 0)) != 0 || /* bool: single connection */
4842 (r = sshpkt_put_cstring(ssh, proto)) != 0 ||
4843 (r = sshpkt_put_cstring(ssh, new_data)) != 0 ||
4844 (r = sshpkt_put_u32(ssh, screen_number)) != 0 ||
4845 (r = sshpkt_send(ssh)) != 0 ||
4846 (r = ssh_packet_write_wait(ssh)) < 0)
4847 fatal("%s: send x11-req: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
4848
4849 free(new_data);
4850}
